template.name: AEalSurface
template.label: alSurface
template.description: Suitable for any dielectric or metallic material including skin, plastic, wood, metal, glass, etc.

attribute.name: diffuseStrength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the diffuse reflection.

attribute.name: diffuseColor
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Color of the diffuse reflection.

attribute.name: diffuseRoughness
attribute.label: Roughness
attribute.description: Roughness of the diffuse reflection. Higher values cause the surface to appear flatter and darker.

attribute.name: backlightStrength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the backlight transmission.

attribute.name: backlightColor
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Color of the backlight transmission.

attribute.name: backlightIndirectStrength
attribute.label: Indirect strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the amount of indirect light transmitted by the backlight lobe.

attribute.name: sssMix
attribute.label: Mix
attribute.description: How much to mix SSS in with the diffuse. 0 means no SSS, full diffuse. 1 means full SSS no diffuse.

attribute.name: sssMode
attribute.label: Mode
attribute.description: Algorithm to use for SSS calculation. cubic is the standard Arnold SSS. The diffusion and directional modes both take longer to calculate but preserve detail much better than the cubic.

attribute.name: sssDensityScale
attribute.label: Density scale
attribute.description: A multiplier on the scale of the object. This simply multiplies down the Distance values below, but can be used to adapt materials from scenes of one scale to another without changing the look.

attribute.name: sssRadius
attribute.label: Distance 1
attribute.description: The scatter distance of the first layer. Higher values mean the light travels further through the object, lower values mean it travels a shorter distance.

attribute.name: sssWeight1
attribute.label: Weight 1
attribute.description: The weight of the first layer. Larger values relative to the other layers will cause more of this layer to be present in the result.

attribute.name: sssRadiusColor
attribute.label: Color 1
attribute.description: The scatter color of the first layer. This is the color the light will tend to the further it travels through the material, e.g. reddish for skin.

attribute.name: sssRadius2
attribute.label: Distance 2
attribute.description: The scatter distance of the second layer. Higher values mean the light travels further through the object, lower values mean it travels a shorter distance.

attribute.name: sssWeight2
attribute.label: Weight 2
attribute.description: The weight of the second layer. Larger values relative to the other layers will cause more of this layer to be present in the result.

attribute.name: sssRadiusColor2
attribute.label: Color 2
attribute.description: The scatter color of the second layer. This is the color the light will tend to the further it travels through the material, e.g. reddish for skin.

attribute.name: sssRadius3
attribute.label: Distance 3
attribute.description: The scatter distance of the third layer. Higher values mean the light travels further through the object, lower values mean it travels a shorter distance.

attribute.name: sssWeight3
attribute.label: Weight 3
attribute.description: The weight of the third layer. Larger values relative to the other layers will cause more of this layer to be present in the result.

attribute.name: sssRadiusColor3
attribute.label: Color 3
attribute.description: The scatter color of the third layer. This is the color the light will tend to the further it travels through the material, e.g. reddish for skin.

attribute.name: sssTraceSet
attribute.label: Trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict the sss to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: diffuseExtraSamples
attribute.label: Diffuse extra samples
attribute.description: Add or subtract samples for the diffuse and backlight lobes from the global sampling rate.

attribute.name: sssExtraSamples
attribute.label: SSS extra samples
attribute.description: Add or subtract samples for the sss lobe from the global sampling rate. Note that this parameter only works with the diffusion and directional modes.

attribute.name: diffuseIndirectStrength
attribute.label: Indirect strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the amount of indirect light transmitted by this lobe.

attribute.name: diffuseIndirectClamp
attribute.label: Indirect clamp
attribute.description: Clamp the brightness of indirect samples for this lobe. This can effectively reduce fireflies but makes the shader less accurate. The default value of 0 means no clamping.

attribute.name: diffuseNormal
attribute.label: Normal
attribute.description: Override the normal used for this lobe.

attribute.name: traceSetDiffuse
attribute.label: Diffuse trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict the diffuse lobe to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: traceSetBacklight
attribute.label: Backlight trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict the backlight lobe to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: specular1Strength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the specular reflection.

attribute.name: specular1Color
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Color tint on the specular reflection.

attribute.name: specular1Roughness
attribute.label: Roughness
attribute.description: The roughness of the specular reflection. Lower numbers produce sharper reflections, higher numbers produce blurrier reflections.

attribute.name: specular1Anisotropy
attribute.label: Anisotropy
attribute.description: Controls how much the specular highlight is stretched along its axis. The default value of 0.5 produces a round highlight. Higher values will stretch the highlight along the V axis, lower values stretch along the U axis.

attribute.name: specular1Rotation
attribute.label: Rotation
attribute.description: Rotates the axis of specular anisotropy around the surface normal. 0 gives no rotation, 0.5 gives 90 degree rotation, 1 gives 180 degree rotation.

attribute.name: specular1FresnelMode
attribute.label: Mode
attribute.description: Selects which mode to use for the fresnel. Dielectric is appropriate for non-conductive materials such as most organics, plastic, glass and water etc. and gives dark reflections at normal incidence and bright reflections at glancing angles.

attribute.name: specular1Ior
attribute.label: IOR
attribute.description: The index of refraction for the dielectric fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular1Reflectivity
attribute.label: Reflectivity
attribute.description: Selects the color of the reflection at normal incidence for the metallic fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular1EdgeTint
attribute.label: Edge tint
attribute.description: Selects the color of the reflection at glancing angles for the metallic fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular1RoughnessDepthScale
attribute.label: Roughness depth scale
attribute.description: Controls how much the specular roughness is scaled with each increasing bounce as a noise-reduction technique.

attribute.name: specular1ExtraSamples
attribute.label: Extra samples
attribute.description: Add or subtract samples for this lobe from the global sampling rate.

attribute.name: specular1Normal
attribute.label: Normal
attribute.description: Override the normal used for this lobe.

attribute.name: specular1IndirectStrength
attribute.label: Indirect strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the amount of indirect light reflected by this lobe.

attribute.name: specular1IndirectClamp
attribute.label: Indirect clamp
attribute.description: Clamp the brightness of indirect samples for this lobe. This can effectively reduce fireflies but makes the shader less accurate. The default value of 0 means no clamping.

attribute.name: traceSetSpecular1
attribute.label: Trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict this lobe to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: specular1CausticPaths
attribute.label: Caustics
attribute.description: Enable this to allow this lobe to form caustic paths. You will need to enable this on all objects in your scene that contribute to the desired caustic. Use this at your own risk, it will be VERY noisy.

attribute.name: specular1InternalDirect
attribute.label: Internal direct reflections
attribute.description: Disable this to turn off direct reflections from the inside of materials. This can give more plausible results in some cases when the default behavior leads to widely separated direct highlights.

attribute.name: specular1Distribution
attribute.label: Distribution
attribute.description: Selects the distribution to use for this specular lobe. GGX matches better to empirical data, and will become the only distribution in a later version..

attribute.name: specular2Strength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the specular reflection.

attribute.name: specular2Color
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Color tint on the specular reflection.

attribute.name: specular2Roughness
attribute.label: Roughness
attribute.description: The roughness of the specular reflection. Lower numbers produce sharper reflections, higher numbers produce blurrier reflections.

attribute.name: specular2Anisotropy
attribute.label: Anisotropy
attribute.description: Controls how much the specular highlight is stretched along its axis. The default value of 0.5 produces a round highlight. Higher values will stretch the highlight along the V axis, lower values stretch along the U axis.

attribute.name: specular2Rotation
attribute.label: Rotation
attribute.description: Rotates the axis of specular anisotropy around the surface normal. 0 gives no rotation, 0.5 gives 90 degree rotation, 1 gives 180 degree rotation.

attribute.name: specular2FresnelMode
attribute.label: Mode
attribute.description: Selects which mode to use for the fresnel. Dielectric is appropriate for non-conductive materials such as most organics, plastic, glass and water etc. and gives dark reflections at normal incidence and bright reflections at glancing angles.

attribute.name: specular2Ior
attribute.label: IOR
attribute.description: The index of refraction for the dielectric fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular2Reflectivity
attribute.label: Reflectivity
attribute.description: Selects the color of the reflection at normal incidence for the metallic fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular2EdgeTint
attribute.label: Edge tint
attribute.description: Selects the color of the reflection at glancing angles for the metallic fresnel mode.

attribute.name: specular2RoughnessDepthScale
attribute.label: Roughness depth scale
attribute.description: Controls how much the specular roughness is scaled with each increasing bounce as a noise-reduction technique.

attribute.name: specular2ExtraSamples
attribute.label: Extra samples
attribute.description: Add or subtract samples for this lobe from the global sampling rate.

attribute.name: specular2Normal
attribute.label: Normal
attribute.description: Override the normal used for this lobe.

attribute.name: specular2IndirectStrength
attribute.label: Indirect strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the amount of indirect light reflected by this lobe.

attribute.name: specular2IndirectClamp
attribute.label: Indirect clamp
attribute.description: Clamp the brightness of indirect samples for this lobe. This can effectively reduce fireflies but makes the shader less accurate. The default value of 0 means no clamping.

attribute.name: traceSetSpecular2
attribute.label: Trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict this lobe to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: specular2CausticPaths
attribute.label: Caustics
attribute.description: Enable this to allow this lobe to form caustic paths. You will need to enable this on all objects in your scene that contribute to the desired caustic. Use this at your own risk, it will be VERY noisy.

attribute.name: specular2InternalDirect
attribute.label: Internal direct reflections
attribute.description: Disable this to turn off direct reflections from the inside of materials. This can give more plausible results in some cases when the default behavior leads to widely separated direct highlights.

attribute.name: specular2Distribution
attribute.label: Distribution
attribute.description: Selects the distribution to use for this specular lobe. GGX matches better to empirical data, and will become the only distribution in a later version..

attribute.name: transmissionStrength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the transmission.

attribute.name: transmissionColor
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the transmission.

attribute.name: transmissionLinkToSpecular1
attribute.label: Link to specular 1
attribute.description: When this is enabled, the transmission lobe will copy its Roughness and IOR values from the Specular 1 lobe. This is generally what you want for most materials.

attribute.name: transmissionRoughness
attribute.label: Roughness
attribute.description: The roughness of the transmission. 0 creates a perfect refracted image like water or highly polished glass. Higher values will give results like frosted glass.

attribute.name: transmissionIor
attribute.label: IOR
attribute.description: The index of refraction of the transmission lobe. Higher values cause a more distorted refracted image.

attribute.name: ssAttenuationColor
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: This is the color light tends towards the further it travels through the material.

attribute.name: ssInScatteringStrength
attribute.label: Scattering
attribute.description: How much in-scattering takes place along the transmitted ray. The default of 0 means no in-scattering. Higher values add more in-scattering at the cost of additional render time.

attribute.name: ssDensityScale
attribute.label: Density scale
attribute.description: A scale factor on the attenuation and scattering effects. Scaller values make the object feel smaller, larger values make the object feel larger.

attribute.name: ssDirection
attribute.label: Direction
attribute.description: The direction, or anisotropy, or the scattering. Values greater than zero means light tends to travel through the material from one side to the other, while values less than zero mean light tends to bounce back in the direction it came from.

attribute.name: transmissionRoughnessDepthScale
attribute.label: Roughness depth scale
attribute.description: Controls how much the roughness is scaled with each increasing bounce as a noise-reduction technique.

attribute.name: transmissionExtraSamples
attribute.label: Extra samples
attribute.description: Add or subtract samples for this lobe from the global sampling rate.

attribute.name: transmissionEnableCaustics
attribute.label: Enable internal reflections
attribute.description: Enables internal reflection bounces. This should generally always be on, but if you don't care about realism you can make materials with rough transmission and reflection render significantly faster by disabling this.

attribute.name: rrTransmissionDepth
attribute.label: RR depth
attribute.description: Controls the depth at which the Russian roulette optimization kicks in. If you find your renders are too noisy with RR on try raising this to 2.

attribute.name: transmissionClamp
attribute.label: Indirect clamp
attribute.description: Clamp the brightness of indirect samples for this lobe. This can effectively reduce fireflies but makes the shader less accurate. The default value of 0 means no clamping.

attribute.name: ssSpecifyCoefficients
attribute.label: Specify attenuation coeffs.
attribute.description: Enable this to directly specify the scattering and absorption parameters rather than use the Color and Scattering controls in the attenutaion section above.

attribute.name: ssScattering
attribute.label: Scattering
attribute.description: Scattering coefficient

attribute.name: ssAbsorption
attribute.label: Absorption
attribute.description: Absorption coefficient

attribute.name: traceSetTransmission
attribute.label: Trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict this lobe to trace only against that set.

attribute.name: transmissionDoDirect
attribute.label: Direct lighting
attribute.description: Enable this to have the transmission lobe calculate direct lighting when leaving a closed volume. This allos you to, for instance, put a glass lens in front of a light source and see the image of the light source in the lens.

attribute.name: transmissionNormal
attribute.label: Normal
attribute.description: Override the normal used for this lobe.

attribute.name: transmissionCausticPaths
attribute.label: Caustics
attribute.description: Enable this to allow this lobe to form caustic paths. You will need to enable this on all objects in your scene that contribute to the desired caustic. Use this at your own risk, it will be VERY noisy.

attribute.name: emissionStrength
attribute.label: Strength
attribute.description: Multiplier on the intensity of the emitted light.

attribute.name: emissionColor
attribute.label: Color
attribute.description: Color tint on the emitted light.

attribute.name: opacity
attribute.label: Opacity
attribute.description: Opacity of the material. In the vast majority of cases, if you want to see through your material you should be using transmission. Opacity can be useful for doing cut out effects such as a leaf texture on a card.

attribute.name: id1
attribute.label: id1
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_1 AOV.

attribute.name: id2
attribute.label: id2
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_2 AOV.

attribute.name: id3
attribute.label: id3
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_3 AOV.

attribute.name: id4
attribute.label: id4
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_4 AOV.

attribute.name: id5
attribute.label: id5
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_5 AOV.

attribute.name: id6
attribute.label: id6
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_6 AOV.

attribute.name: id7
attribute.label: id7
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_7 AOV.

attribute.name: id8
attribute.label: id8
attribute.description: Color to be output in id_8 AOV.

attribute.name: crypto_asset_override
attribute.label: Crypto asset override
attribute.description: Overide the cryptomatte asset string for this shader

attribute.name: crypto_object_override
attribute.label: Crypto object override
attribute.description: Overide the cryptomatte object string for this shader

attribute.name: crypto_material_override
attribute.label: Crypto material override
attribute.description: Overide the cryptomatte material string for this shader

attribute.name: standardCompatibleAOVs
attribute.label: Write standard AOVs only
attribute.description: Enable this to combine the AOVs into only the set that the standard shader outputs.

attribute.name: transmitAovs
attribute.label: Transmit AOVs
attribute.description: When enabled on all surfaces in the scene, this will pull the AOVs through transmissive objects, so glass objects etc. will get the diffuse AOV of the objects they refract.

attribute.name: aov_diffuse_color_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_direct_diffuse_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_direct_diffuse_raw_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_indirect_diffuse_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_indirect_diffuse_raw_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_direct_backlight_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_indirect_backlight_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_direct_specular_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_indirect_specular_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_direct_specular_2_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_indirect_specular_2_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_single_scatter_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_sss_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_refraction_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_emission_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_1_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_2_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_3_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_4_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_5_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_6_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_7_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: aov_light_group_8_clamp
attribute.label: Clamp
attribute.description: Clamp this AOV to this value

attribute.name: rr
attribute.label: RR
attribute.description: When this is enabled the shader will automatically stop tracing indirect bounces when the final contribution for continuing would be insignificant. This allows you to go to very high ray depths without a significant render time hit.

attribute.name: traceSetAll
attribute.label: Global trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict the shader to trace only against that set. Entering a different trace set in the individual lobes' Trace set parameters will override the one set here.

attribute.name: traceSetShadows
attribute.label: Shadow trace set
attribute.description: Enter the name of a trace set here to restrict the shader to trace only against that set for shadows.

attribute.name: debug
attribute.label: Debug
attribute.description: Select a component here to replace the shader result with that component. This allows you to quickly debug your inputs and check value ranges while setting up shading.
